title: Why I Love Singlehood by Elisa Lorello and Sarah Girrell.mobi
description:
Eva Perino is single and proud of it. So proud, in fact, that she regularly boasts about it in her blog, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Why I Love Singlehood.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ But upon learning of her ex-boyfriendÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s engagement, Eva discovers her foundation is weaker than her faÃƒÂ§ade. So begins a clumsy (and occasionally uproarious) search for love as she secretly joins an online dating site, tries her hand at speed dating, and gets involved with one of the regulars at her coffee shop, The Grounds. But the self-prescribed Ã¢â‚¬Å“experimentÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ quickly unravels as Eva witnesses the trials and tribulations of her best friend MinervaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s marriage, her sisterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s suburban family, her manager NormanÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s possible crush on her, and the one guy she canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t seem to stop thinking about. Soon, EvaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s simple search for a date becomes a deeper exploration of love Ã¢â‚¬â€ sexual, platonic, and familial Ã¢â‚¬â€ and a powerful examination of who (or what) is the true love of her life.

Sparkling with warmth and wit, Why I Love Singlehood is a delicious and insightful must-listen for anyone - single or otherwise - who has ever been stymied by love.
Genre: Fiction; chic-lit
